attributes.action: Make at least 50% of BBC & C4 shows come from professionally debuting writers.
attributes.additional_details:
There are many exceptional, original writers who are unable to ‘break in’ to the industry. At the same time, broadcasters show many formulaic programmes.

Part of the remit of Government-linked broadcasters like Channel 4 and the BBC should be to showcase groundbreaking writing. The introduction of fresh new voices is surely key to this.

This measure would:

1) Enrich the cultural life of the nation.

2) Boost new talent.

3) ‘Level up’ and help address the cost of living crisis.
attributes.background: Create a law that forces Government-linked broadcasters (such as the BBC and Channel 4) to support new creative voices, by mandating them to commission and buy at least 50% of shows from writers with no previous professional credits in film or TV.
